note.p: Burial: St Bride's, Fleet Street, London
Education: Aberdeen; MA; incorporated at Cambridge (1667) and Oxford (1669); Middle Temple (admitted 1669); MD (Oxford 1681 and Cambridge Com Reg 1682)
Career: Surgeon to St Thomas's and St Bartholomew's Hospitals, London; Master of Surgery to Charles II and James II; friend of George Berkeley, 1st Earl Berkeley
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; Venn; Foster; Hunter; MT
Authority: AltName surname Milne from Hunter
References: G C R Morris, 'On the Identity of Jaques du Moulin, FRS 1667' in NR 1991 vol 45 pp 1-10
Notes: According to Hunter, he was expelled in 1682.
